meanings.definition: To carve, engrave, or sculpt into a surface.
meanings.sent1: The artist will insculp his name on the stone tablet.
meanings.sent2: She used a sharp tool to insculp a heart shape on the tree bark.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to insculp its initials on the wooden bench.
meanings.sent4: His words were insculped in her memory forever.
meanings.sent5: The ancient hieroglyphics insculped on the temple walls told stories of the past.

meanings.definition: To impress or stamp a design or image onto a surface.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler will insculp intricate patterns on the silver bracelet.
meanings.sent2: He carefully insculped the company logo on each product.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to insculp a smiley face on the wet cement.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was insculped in the hearts of everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight insculped a magical glow on the calm lake surface.
